parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To shake off; mid: I shake off from myself. From ek and tinasso; to shake violently.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Dust. From the base of koniao and ornumi; pulverulence.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
